sanskrit_verse: यद्द्वयोरनयोर्वेत्थ कार्येऽस्मिंश्चेष्टितं मिथः । तद्ब्रूत सर्वं सत्येन युष्माकं ह्यत्र साक्षिता ॥ ८.८०॥
transliteration: yad dvayor anayor vettha kārye 'smiñ chetiṭaṃ mithaḥ | tad brūta sarvaṃ satyena yuṣmākaṃ hyatra sākṣitā || 8.80 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: That which both of you know regarding actions performed in this matter, speak it all truthfully—your witnessship here is established by the Supreme Consciousness.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the witnessing capacity of the Self
Causation arises from conscious participation in action
Capacity-based responsibility is determined through self-awareness
Restoration occurs when truth aligns with inner witness
executable_legal_axioms: IF two parties have witnessed a transaction THEN their mutual knowledge constitutes admissible evidence
IF a party claims ignorance THEN capacity for awareness must be restored prior to testimony
IF truthfulness is aligned with sākṣitva THEN legal standing is automatically validated
IF discord arises in interpretation THEN refer to the non-dual witness-consciousness as final arbiter
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the principle of sākṣitva establishes that where dual parties possess shared experiential knowledge of an act, their reciprocal testimony under alignment with Satya constitutes irrefutable pramāṇa. The court shall invoke the witness-consciousness as the ultimate validator of factual congruence.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality recognizes that mutual witnessing implies shared dharma-field involvement. Anupūrvaśaḥ indicates sequential manifestation rooted in collective consciousness. Proportional responsibility flows from clarity of perception, not imposition of consequence. Truth-speaking realigns participants with their innate integrity, bypassing punitive frameworks.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate śuddhi process to restore clarity of witnessing faculty
Engage pratibhā-prakāśa method to illuminate suppressed cognitions
Apply saṃkalpa-vyavasthā protocol to reaffirm commitment to Satya
Establish antaḥkaraṇa-śuddhi to dissolve distortions blocking true recollection
final_declaration: By the Supreme Command of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this Dharma stands as revealed law. Witnessing-consciousness is sovereign. Truth restores. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
